text:
Good morning all,

Working with teh single send transactional email endpoint in a custom crm card. Currently the email sends from the user initiating the send. How would we update the "from" email address?
As of now I've got the "from" property set to an input value from the CRM card form. Based on the documentation I do not think this is the intended function of the property.
Yes that wouldn't show the associations because that\'s the batch task api not the batch associations api, please review the link I sent above
<@U04NES57R0D>
The from is just the name that will show up on the email, that's not what your trying to change right you want to change the email address it comes from?
<@U01QVR44MEY> correct!

pardon my take here, think I got a little ahead of myself.
The emails are "from" "via <http://transactional.HubSpotemail.net|transactional.HubSpotemail.net>"
• the from is just the title (as you pointed out)
we probably cant change the actual address that they come from
Even with an updated from property , the from header does have the initiators email and not the input vallue
You can change the email address you just change it on a per email basic because you send emails with templates
~Might you have the docs on hand that cover that?~
<@U01QVR44MEY> very much appreciate all of your input!
of course, docs: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/create-and-send-marketing-emails-with-the-updated-classic-editor>
actually you know what that article doesn't show how to change the email from addresss
one moment
but it makes sense how to change the email address right?
what's the error that coming later?

Hello again! With your help and some researching and testing we almost achieved one of our goals, tracking a thread and allow the user reply to these thread with the Conversations API. But here I found one stopper, I need to add the `senderActorId` in the RQ body, I get it through the `conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}/messages` response. The problem is that the ID is of type visitor and when I try to send the message I get this error: `"ActorType `VISITOR` is not supported for `sending`"`.

In the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations#get-actors|doc> I can see that the Visitor type may not be a contact yet.

Here is my doubt: Did you know how can I manage these types of Ids? I mean, right now I have a Contact in HS but my actorId is of type Visitor, is there a simple way to manage this or am I missing something?
any other ideas? <@U01QVR44MEY>

Hi <@U05072J3HPG> , the short answer is that the error message you are getting is because the Conversations API in Beta currently does not support your use case of wanting to post _inbound_ messages (as your customers) to the HubSpot Inbox. That endpoint is only for posting _outbound_ messages (as a HubSpot 'agent' i.e. a user of your HubSpot account). That's mentioned right <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations#send-messages-to-threads|here>, and it's making me want to clarify the overview portion of this same documentation to provide more clarity on what's possible today.
<@U04B32JHTUZ> really just this line needs to be updated:
yup exactly, will put in a docs ticket today.  send _outbound_ messages
:fire:
Not exactly sure how the slack integration works (only HubSpot knows that because they built it) but it's likely that they are using some undocumented functionality. Again not really sure though

might also change the wording of this one
> • Search conversations inboxes, channels, threads, and messages.
Got an internal support question about this. We don't mean that there is anything fancy like the CRM Search API
we just mean you can GET and filter and sort by a variety of properties so maybe something like
> _Query_ conversations inboxes, channels, threads, and messages.

Maybe just:
> _Get and sort_ conversations inboxes, channels, threads, and messages.
Absolutely, thanks again!
of course
I just replaced {objectType} with tasks, what am I supposed to replace it with?
<@U01QVR44MEY>
Sorry bro, sent the wrong endpoint screenshot lol:
gotcha haha, you're good, let me try that out

By "get around" do you mean:
1. Have more than 4/second per one portal
2. limit the code to only be able to hit the endpoint 4/second
(there's 2 very different answers)
<@U01QVR44MEY> limiting the code to stay within that 4/second limit
with the above, I thought it would be save but when looping over items and searching, it still hits rate limit each time
Honestly I would think that would also work, although I only use axios for my calls not SDK
<@U25PYL3Q8> you're a lot more familiar with the SDK, should this work?
Wouldn’t 3 concurrent over 550 ms be (up to) 6/1100ms which is > 4/s?
hi all, Does anyone have a timeout or connection reset on the deals API? Does anyone know the connection timeout?
